member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.IssueDetected
member.summary: Potential issues that are detected based on an artificial intelligence analysis of each turn in the conversation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.IssueDetected.CharacterOffsets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CharacterOffsets.
The offset for when the issue was detected in the segment.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegmentsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegments operation. Provides a list of analysis segments for a real-time analysis session.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegmentsRequest.ContactId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContactId.
The identifier of the contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegmentsRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegmentsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximimum number of results to return per page.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegmentsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of results.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegmentsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegments operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegmentsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of results. If response includes nextToken there are two possible scenarios:
There are more segments so another call is required to get them.
There are no more segments at this time, but more may be available later (real-time analysis is in progress) so the client should call the operation again to get new segments.
If response does not include nextToken, the analysis is completed (successfully or failed) and there are no more segments to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.ListRealtimeContactAnalysisSegmentsResponse.Segments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Segments.
An analyzed transcript or category.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.PointOfInterest
member.summary: The section of the contact audio where that category rule was detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.PointOfInterest.BeginOffsetMillis
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeginOffsetMillis.
The beginning offset in milliseconds where the category rule was detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.PointOfInterest.EndOffsetMillis
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndOffsetMillis.
The ending offset in milliseconds where the category rule was detected.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.RealtimeContactAnalysisSegment
member.summary: An analyzed segment for a real-time analysis session.

member.summary:

The matched category rules.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.Model.RealtimeContactAnalysisSegment.Transcript
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.AmazonConnectContactLensClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing ConnectContactLens
Contact Lens for Amazon Connect enables you to analyze conversations between customer and agents, by using speech transcription, natural language processing, and intelligent search capabilities. It performs sentiment analysis, detects issues, and enables you to automatically categorize contacts.
Contact Lens for Amazon Connect provides both real-time and post-call analytics of customer-agent conversations. For more information, see Analyze conversations using Contact Lens in the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.AmazonConnectContactLensClient.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.AmazonConnectContactLensClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonConnectContactLensClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.ConnectContactLens.AmazonConnectContactLensClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
